remarks:
The relation induced by a transitive relation on a part of its field is transitive.  (Taking the intersection of a relation with a square Cartesian product is a way to restrict it to a subset of its field.) (Contributed by FL, 31-Jul-2009.) 

---

 The relation induced by a transitive relation on a part of its field is transitive.  (Taking the intersection of a relation with a square cross product is a way to restrict it to a subset of its field.)  (Contributed by FL, 31-Jul-2009.)
